1.name: It Happened One Night
1.description: A spoiled heiress running away from her family is helped by a man who is actually a reporter in need of a story.

2.name: The Thin Man
2.description: Former detective Nick Charles and his wealthy wife Nora investigate a murder case, mostly for the fun of it.

3.name: Tarzan and His Mate
3.description: The idyllic life of Tarzan and Jane is challenged by men on safari who come seeking ivory, and come seeking Jane as well.

4.name: Of Human Bondage
4.description: A young man finds himself attracted to a cold and unfeeling waitress who may ultimately destroy them both.

5.name: The Black Cat
5.description: American honeymooners in Hungary become trapped in the home of a Satan-worshiping priest when the bride is taken there for medical help following a road accident.

6.name: The Man Who Knew Too Much
6.description: A man and his wife receive a clue to an imminent assassination attempt, only to learn that their daughter has been kidnapped to keep them quiet.

7.name: Stand Up and Cheer!
7.description: President Franklin Roosevelt appoints a theatrical producer as the new Secretary of Amusement in order to cheer up an American public still suffering through the Depression. The new ...                See full summary »

8.name: Babes in Toyland
8.description: Opposing the evil Barnaby, Ollie Dee and Stanley Dum try and fail to pay-off Mother Peep's mortgage and mislead his attempts to marry Little Bo. Enraged, Barnaby's Bogeymen are set on Toyland.

9.name: The Scarlet Pimpernel
9.description: A noblewoman discovers her husband is The Scarlet Pimpernel, a vigilante who rescues aristocrats from the blade of the guillotine.

10.name: L'Atalante
10.description: Newly married couple Juliette and a ship captain Jean struggle through marriage as they travel on the L'atalante along with the captain's first mate Le père Jules and a cabin boy.

11.name: The Gay Divorcee
11.description: An American woman travels to England to seek a divorce from her absentee husband, where she meets - and falls for - a dashing performer.

12.name: Imitation of Life
12.description: A struggling widow and her daughter take in a black housekeeper and her fair-skinned daughter; the two women start a successful business, but face familial, identity, and racial issues along the way.

13.name: Cleopatra
13.description: The man-hungry Queen of Egypt leads Julius Caesar and Mark Antony astray, amid scenes of DeMillean splendor.

14.name: Treasure Island
14.description: Young Jim Hawkins is torn between his loyalty to his benefactors and his affection for lovable rogue Long John Silver in their struggle to recover a buried pirate treasure.

15.name: The Trail Beyond
15.description: Rod Drew hunts for a missing girl and finds himself in a fight over a goldmine as well.

16.name: The Scarlet Empress
16.description: A German noblewoman enters into a loveless marriage with the dim-witted, unstable heir to the Russian throne, then plots to oust him from power.

17.name: The Count of Monte Cristo
17.description: After greedy men have Edmound Dantes unjustly imprisoned for 20 years for innocently delivering a letter entrusted to him, he escapes to get his revenge on them.

18.name: Death Takes a Holiday
18.description: The Grim Reaper (Frederic March) takes the form of a Prince in an attempt to relate to humans and, along the way, also learns what it is to love.

19.name: Twentieth Century
19.description: A flamboyant Broadway impresario who has fallen on hard times tries to get his former lover, now a Hollywood diva, to return and resurrect his failing career.

20.name: Bright Eyes
20.description: An orphaned girl is taken in by a snobbish family at the insistence of their rich, crotchety uncle, even as her devoted aviator godfather fights for custody.

21.name: It's a Gift
21.description: A henpecked New Jersey grocer makes plans to move to California to grow oranges, despite the resistance of his overbearing wife.

22.name: Anne of Green Gables
22.description: A romantic teenage girl is adopted by a pair of elderly siblings in turn-of-the-century Canada.

23.name: Fashions of 1934
23.description: Sherwood Nash is a swindler who bootlegs Paris fashions for sale at cut-rate prices. His assistant Lynn poses as An American interested in a dress and Snap conceals a camera in his cane. ...                See full summary »

24.name: Maniac
24.description: A former vaudevillian gifted at impersonation assists a mad scientist in reanimating corpses and soon goes mad himself.

25.name: The Merry Widow
25.description: When a small kingdom's main tax payer leaves for Paris, its king dispatches a dashing count to win back her allegiance.

26.name: Belle of the Nineties
26.description: Ruby Carter, the American Beauty queen of the night club-sporting world, shifts her operations from St. Louis to New Orleans (which kind of belies the Western genre designation), mostly to ...                See full summary »

27.name: The Star Packer
27.description: A gang working for The Shadow is terrorizing the town. John Travers decides to take on the job of sheriff and do something about it.

28.name: Blue Steel
28.description: U.S. marshal John Carruthers observes a robbery and Sheriff Jake thinks he may be the culprit. Meanwhile the town's leading citizen is planning to rob everybody blind.

29.name: Liliom
29.description: Two women love the same man in a world of few prospects. In Budapest, Liliom is a "public figure," a rascal who's a carousel barker, loved by the experienced merry-go-round owner and by a ...                See full summary »

30.name: Manhattan Melodrama
30.description: The friendship between two orphans endures even though they grow up on opposite sides of the law and fall in love with the same woman.

31.name: The Painted Veil
31.description: A wife neglected by her husband, a medical researcher in China, falls in love with a dashing diplomatic attaché.

32.name: The Lost Patrol
32.description: A dozen British soldiers, lost in a Mesopotamian desert during World War I, are menaced by unseen Arab enemies.

33.name: The House of Rothschild
33.description: The wealthy Rothschild family undergoes prejudice from the anti-Semitic society they live within.

34.name: Now and Forever
34.description: A swindler and his girlfriend take in his young daughter, who has been living with the family of his deceased wife.

35.name: Charlie Chan in London
35.description: Charlie visits a wealthy country home in England. Suspects in the murder range from a housekeeper, to a stableman, to a lawyer.

36.name: Little Miss Marker
36.description: Little Martha Jane, aka Little Miss Marker (Temple) is left with the bookmaker Sorrowful Jones by her dad as part of a bet on a horserace. Sorrowful (Menjou) and his group of fellow bookies...                See full summary »

37.name: Moulin Rouge
37.description: A singer marries a famous composer, and after a while she gets the itch to go back on the stage. However, her husband won't let her. When she hears that a popular French singer named "...                See full summary »

38.name: Evelyn Prentice
38.description: The neglected wife of a high profile attorney dallies with a unscrupulous womanizer and finds herself involved in blackmail and murder.

39.name: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
39.description: Elizabeth Barrett's tyrannical father has forbidden any of his family to marry. Nevertheless, Elizabeth falls in love with the poet Robert Browning.

40.name: Rapt
40.description: Hans has killed the dog of Firmin, a shepherd. Wild with rage, Firmin kidnaps Elsi, Hans' fiancée and locks her up at his home. Hans, a peddler, vows to find the missing girl. This is what ...                See full summary »

41.name: Baby, Take a Bow
41.description: Eddie Ellison is an ex-con who spent time in Sing-Sing prison. Kay marries him as soon as he serves his time. Five years later, Eddie and his ex-convict buddy Larry, have both gone straight...                See full summary »

42.name: Zouzou
42.description: Zou Zou tries to help her childhood friend prove his innocence after he's accused of murder.

43.name: Les misérables
43.description: The lives of numerous people over the course of 20 years in 19th century France, weaved together by the story of an ex-convict named Jean Valjean on the run from an obsessive police inspector, who pursues him for only a minor offense.

44.name: This Side of Heaven
44.description: A family man. (Lionel Barrymore) becomes innocently involved in an embezzlement.

45.name: Fog Over Frisco
45.description: The lifestyles of Arlene and Valkyr Bradford, half-sisters from a respected San Francisco family, diverge markedly as Arlene takes up with criminals.

46.name: Mauvaise graine
46.description: A young man-about-Paris, cut off from his father's money, falls in with a picaresque gang of car thieves.

47.name: Search for Beauty
47.description: Three con artists dupe two Olympians into serving as editors of a new health and beauty magazine which is only a front for salacious stories and pictures.

48.name: Waltzes from Vienna
48.description: The story of Johann Strauss the elder and younger.

49.name: Kiss and Make-Up
49.description: Dr. Maurice Lamar is a noted plastic-surgeon who makes his rich clients beautiful, and also makes them. He makes Eve Caron, the wife of Marcel Caron, so satisfied with his skilled hands ...                See full summary »

50.name: Judge Priest
50.description: Judge Priest, a proud Confederate veteran, uses common sense and considerable humanity to dispense justice in a small town in the Post-Bellum Kentucky.
